answers.answer: Diabetes runs in my family as well and I've had problems with blood sugar randomly through out my life, I had symptoms of passing out, I'd eat and become exhausted and feel like I hadn't slept in days. That's how I actually found out I pregnant. I passed my glucose test on the first try, it was actually on the low end of average. The passing out lasted all through my pregnancy, it did get quite a bit better after I found out I had low iron and started taking iron supplements daily. Sorry it's so long :)
What gets me though is my iron is fine...  But I'm a waitress an this is happening at work more than once a night... It happened 4 times within 6 hours yesterday and it's starting to scare me

question: I'm 11 wks 3 days... I have had every symptom of my sugar bottoming out, including passing out. Could this be my body's way of telling me I'm going to have gestational diabetes? My baby's dad is a borderline diabetic, it runs in his family, and hypoglycemia and diabetes runs in my side of the family... Help and advice please!!!
title: Gestational diabetes??? Is it to early???
